newsitem.title: JAPAN: NCB's 4.6% bond due Nov 97 traded at 5.5% - traders.
newsitem.headline: NCB's 4.6% bond due Nov 97 traded at 5.5% - traders.

text.p: Nippon Credit Bank's 4.6 percent five-year bank debentures due November 1997 were traded at a yield of 5.5 percent on Friday, bond traders said.
This compares with a yield of 6.1 percent on Monday, the last time these particular debentures were traded.
About 500 million yen worth of trades took place, traders said.
Also, about 500 million yen worth of NCB's 4.8 percent five-year debentures due October 1997 were traded at 5.4 percent.

Market yields of NCB debentures with a remaining life of less than one year have fallen since Thursday's announcement that NCB and Bankers Trust New York Corp had agreed on a business alliance, traders said.
Before the announcement, these debentures were being traded at around six percent.
But NCB debentures with a remaining life of more than two years were still being offered at seven percent or above, traders said.
For example, NCB's 4.0 percent five-year debentures due February 2000 were offered at a yield of seven percent on Friday.

"Sentiment has somewhat improved since the NCB-Bankers tie-up news. But people are still cautious about buying NCB debentures with longer remaining life, as uncertainties about the bank's future still remain," said a brokerage house trader.
